column4: what is the command for bringing up a wireless network in ubuntu?
dabar: I want to bring up my wlan so I can use it
how do I run a graphical KDE program as root?
assuming I odn't know the command line command that normally opens it?
find out the command line first. if the program's in the K menu, you can right click on the K menu, do "Menu editor", and find out the command's name.
and it still says that you have insufficient permissions because you didn't run it with sudo
what does it say exactly? wlassistant AFAIK doesn't even normally *need* to be run as root, so it'd strike me as strange if it complained that you didn't run it with sudo
when I run it normally, it says "You might have insufficient permissions for Wireless assistant to function properly. Did you run it using sudo?"
and hten it gives an okay box to go to the main program
but it doesn't find any networks
and I'm pretty sure that ubuntu is actually detecting my network card, because it shows up in /sbin/iwconfig
it doesn't ask me that, but then that might be because i don't *have* a wireless card... try plain "sudo wlassistant" perhaps. though "kdesu wlassistant" should be fine if not better :-\
